client_profile: A couple looking to buy an apartment in Brussels with a budget of 490,000–895,000 EUR. Priorities include cafes, expat community, value for money, and a residential, quiet environment.
must_have: Proximity to cafes and brunch spots
red_flags: High noise levels in certain areas
Potential for budget limits to stretch
contradictions: Quiet living may limit cafe options
Desirable expat areas can be expensive
Residential zones might have fewer brunch spots
Value for money may compromise space

top_districts.name: Schaerbeek
why: Schaerbeek features lovely parks like Josaphat Park that promote outdoor living.
The neighborhood is well-connected for those commuting within Brussels.
watch_out: Expect higher demand which may elevate prices unexpectedly.

top_districts.name: Ixelles
why: Ixelles boasts a vibrant mix of cultures, ideal for an international community.
Easy access to parks and urban amenities creates a balanced lifestyle.
